dmca.title: Copyright Violations on Your Server
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: admin@go-mama-hosting.com [mailto:admin@go-mama-hosting.com] 
Sent: Thursday, February 01, 2007 4:37 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: Copyright Violations on Your Server

Attention:
Lance Crosby, Esq. - Designated Agent for DMCA Notices
SoftLayer Technologies, Inc.
6400 International Parkway
Suite 1200
Plano, TX 75093

Hello,

I am writing to serve notice under the Digital Millenium Copyright  
Act, of multiple copyright violations on a site hosted on one of your  
servers.

Please find below extensive specific details of the situation.

Overview:
The site is http://www.crazimillion.com - on the server 75.126.60.124
This site is involved in software piracy, circulating copies of  
varioous software scripts at low prices without rights to do so.  As a  
part of that operation they are using images and demo sites which they  
do not have the right to use.

Specific Details:

The following images are stolen - these images were created by myself:

You can see from the following pages they are linking to demo copies  
of scripts installed on sub-domains at our site :
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=38 (Randomizer Demo)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=36 (PTR Monitor)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=33 (Million Pixels 3)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=25 (Cash Crusader)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=23 (Autosurf)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=22 (Autosurf Monitor)
http://www.crazimillion.com/ViewItem.php?ItemID=110 (TEIAB)

All of the above scripts are licensed for sale by resellers only, at  
minimum retail prices far higher than the prices offered by this site.  
  I am personally in contact with the authors of all of these scripts  
over this issue.

Also of note is that when I started compiling information for this  
email, the site was hosted on a server with ThePlanet.  Now I see the  
DNS has been updated today to your server.

I urge you to take action to close down this site immediately.  If  
there is anything further I can do in terms of providing further  
evidence, such as source files for the images, or contact details of  
the script authors, please let me know.

Please note that the discussion of the script piracy is incidental to  
the primary claim of copyright violation, simply because I do not  
personally hold copyright on the scripts.  I do however claim  
copyright on the images, and the designs of the demo sites being used  
- I have contacted the software authors and suggested they contact you  
on their own behalf.

Please note that I hereby warrant that the information in this  
notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, state that I  
am the owner, of an exclusive right that has been infringed.

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best Regards,

Kevin Martin
